Lažnim ameriškim vojakom na berlinskem Checkpoint Charlieju odzvonilo
05 Nov 2019, 12:16 by STA

V ameriške vojake preoblečenim igralcem, ki so turistom na znamenitem nekdanjem mejnem prehodu Checkpoint Charlie v Berlinu zaračunavali za fotografije, je odzvonilo. Pristojne berlinske oblasti so se zaradi pritožb meščanov in turistov odločile, da bodo lažne ameriške vojake poslej preganjale, kar so jim tudi že sporočile.



V ameriške vojake preoblečenim igralcem, ki so turistom na znamenitem nekdanjem mejnem prehodu Checkpoint Charlie v Berlinu zaračunavali za fotografije, je odzvonilo. Foto: Vir: Wikipedia

BERLIN > Kot je v ponedeljek poročala nemška tiskovna agencija dpa, so v berlinskem okrožnem uradu Friedrichshain-Kreuzberg navedli, da igralcev, oblečenih v ameriške vojake, ne bodo več trpeli in da so jim tudi že sporočili, da morajo poslej ob opravljanju te dejavnosti računati na kazenski pregon.
Kot so še zapisali v pristojnem uradu, so igralci mimoidoče nadlegovali oz. dejansko silili, da so v kontrolni baraki plačali za fotografiranje z njimi. Zato so se oblasti že avgusta odločile, da temu naredijo konec. Če bodo igralci nadaljevali svojo dejavnost, bodo oblasti v skladu s pristojnostmi uveljavile prepoved, tudi s pomočjo policije, če bo treba, so dodali.
Po poročanju časnika Bild so lažni vojaki za fotografiranje zaračunavali štiri evre, dnevni zaslužek pa naj bi znašal od 1500 do celo 5000 evrov. Turistom naj bi prodajali tudi lažne vizume z lažnimi štampiljkami. Policisti v civilu so ugotovili, da so turiste celo zmerjali, če so zavrnili "donacijo", je še poročal Bild.
Igralci so se na odločitev urada Friedrichshain-Kreuzberg odzvali z nerazumevanjem. Vodja igralske skupine Dance Factory, ki združuje igralce, preoblečene v vojake, Tom Luszeit, je povedal, da je moral zaradi nenadne prepovedi odpustiti šest sodelavcev. "A ne bomo obupali, želimo se vrniti," je dodal za Bild.
Nekdanji mejni prehod Checkpoint Charlie v Kreuzbergu je ena izmed priljubljenih turističnih točk v Berlinu. Tu so si konec oktobra 1961 16 ur nasproti stali ruski in ameriški tanki, svet pa je trepetal pred novo vojno. Na območju so prehod rekonstruirali predvsem v turistične namene, okoli sto metrov stran pa sta še ohranjena tudi originalni del Berlinskega zidu in mejni steber.
Današnja mešanica zgodovine, turizma in trgovine na Checkpoint Charlieju je v Berlinu v zadnjih letih že večkrat izzvala kritike.

Fake US soldiers at Berlin's Checkpoint Charlie rang
05 Nov 2019, 12:16 by STA

US soldiers dressed as tourists charging tourists at the famous former Checkpoint Charlie border crossing in Berlin echoed. Due to complaints from the townspeople and tourists, the competent Berlin authorities have decided to prosecute the fake US troops, which they have already reported.



US soldiers dressed as tourists charging tourists at the famous former Checkpoint Charlie border crossing in Berlin echoed. Photo: Source: Wikipedia

BERLIN> The German dpa news agency reported on Monday that Berlin-based Friedrichshain-Kreuzberg office stated that players dressed in US troops would no longer suffer and had already been told that they would have to reckon with this activity to law enforcement.
As stated in the competent office, the players were harassing or passing by. actually forcing them to pay at the control bar to take pictures with them. That's why the authorities decided in August to put an end to this. If the players continue their activity, the authorities will enforce the ban in accordance with their powers, even with the help of the police if necessary, they added.
According to the Bild newspaper, fake shooting soldiers were charged four euros, with daily earnings ranging from $ 1,500 to $ 5,000. The tourists are also supposed to be selling fake visas with fake prints. Police officers in civilians found that they even rebuked tourists for refusing a "donation", Bild reported.
The players reacted to the Friedrichshain-Kreuzberg decision with a misunderstanding. The leader of the Dance Factory group, which brings together soldiers dressed as soldiers, Tom Luszeit, said he had to fire six associates due to a sudden ban. "But we won't give up, we want to go back," he added to Bild.
The former Checkpoint Charlie border crossing in Kreuzberg is one of Berlin's favorite tourist spots. Here at the end of October 1961, Russian and American tanks stood for 16 hours, and the world trembled before the new war. The passage was reconstructed mainly for tourist purposes, while the original part of the Berlin Wall and the border pillar are still preserved about a hundred meters away.
Today's mix of history, tourism and commerce at Checkpoint Charlie has drawn a lot of criticism in Berlin in recent years.
